Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at a fab 5* Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CullT
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, in a great central location. A most enjoyable stay. I recommend trying local restaurants more off the 'tourist trail' & central piazza's, we found some absolte gems at great value for money, although the language barrier was a struggle at times, we managed! I loved the 'Jewish' quarter on the other side of the river from the hotel, a more 'genuine' experience here, and again chose the 'local' cafe bars & eateries, very authentic & reasonable! One word of warning, when you arrive at Rome airport be very cautious with regards to the taxi's, we had an unfortunate experience on arrival where we just jumped into a taxi at the 'rank' but were over-charged at €80 and the driver wouldn't take us all the way to the door of the Hotel due to some minor road works at the top of the narrow street where the St George is! We argued a little but the driver got quite aggresive so we threw €70 at him, told him that was all he was getting & walked the 5 minutes to the hotel. On the way back to the airport we arranged our taxi through the Hotel reception & paid only €55. Overall a brilliant city break to Rome, enhanced by a lovely Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Matt C
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel I've been so far regarding the hospitality. From the moment we arrived I felt relaxed. I was handed over to a dllelightful lady who checked me with efficiency. Beds are very confortable. We had a junior suite with a bedroom and a living area : it is unusual to have benefits on complimentary basis like free pay tv package. Redtaurant staff is friendly and professional. Buffet breakfast is delicious and good. Roof top floor was closed. Location is good, minutes away from the st Peter's basilica and the city centre. Our thanks to Antonio for making our stay so special.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: rokalefi
Reviews.Content: We stayed their with our kids and booked two rooms. They upgraded our kids to a DeLuxe romm becaused we asked them if we could stay on the same floor. Rooms are very nice and clean. Breakfast is italian style and not really 5* but still very good. Staff in the whole hotel is very helpful and nice with everything you need. Hotel has a perfect location and is on a quiete street. We definetely recommend this place and defenetly would go back there - now since we now all the vicinity ;)

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Audoor F
Reviews.Content: Excellent 5 star hotel in Rome, the location is great. There is a little traffic in the street . The beds are very comfortable. With closed windows , you can't hear any noise from the street. The service and the staff is the best. Net time we will know where to go to !!!

Reviews.Title: “best choice”
Reviews.Author: Alessandro F
Reviews.Content: I have been in different 5 stars hotel in Rome, but the St. George its really the best. The location its great and the hotel room and the service absolutely number one! Next time i will know where to go......

Reviews.Title: “St. George: Just great!”
Reviews.Author: Paul Jphon B
Reviews.Content: A cosy and elegant hotel away from noise and traffic. The staff is very helpful and courteus. Accommodation is very comfortable. I was with my family and we booked a junior suit . I think this was the ideal choice with exclusive advantages free of charge like internet, gift (buiscuit of Rome, very appreciated) and free access to pay-tv channels... Breakfast was good with a lot of choice like fresh fruit, cooked eggs, bacon ....like american style. Treat you to a walk in Giulia street, an all Roman experience. I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “ST. GEORGE ... Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: 121stewart_m_12121
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife arrived at the hotel late in the night. As the room requested was no more availbale, we have been upgraded to a junior suite and offer for a full complimentary use of pay tv and internet access: excellent ! the sain tgeorge is a kind of boutique hotel . Wines in the bar are deliciou. you can find typical italian food . a little be expensive but was very good. In the restaurant we were surprised to receive a complimentary bottle of tuscany Chianti wien: it was our wedding anniversary. We also went to the spa expecting the usual hotel fitness centre, but... wow very impressed. Thanl you to the maitre and thank you to all the staff at the hote. Would recommend the St. George anytime you are staying in Rome. :-)

Reviews.Title: “superior location takes its toll”
Reviews.Author: Yaron G
Reviews.Content: We held a surprise gathering for a dear friend - and took 9 rooms. The staff were extremely friendly - and helped us prepare for the surprise. We spend a great long weekend in Roma (pay the Roman's some respect and call it Roma, not Rome...). The hotel was indeed comfortable and cozy- but the highlight was its location: Via Giulia is a real gem with the original dark stones still in place since 1508 and some houses from the same period still exist. The Hotel is in walking distance from the Piazza Navona and the Pantheon - and therefore all the cool places within the narrow streets - all the way to the delicious restaurants in the Jewish Ghetto. The hotel is also near the river, and upon 10 min. walk and across the river is the Trastevere with very lively scene. But location takes its toll... Via Giulia is very close to the river and at any hour you could detect if the 130 Kph that just passed was a Moto Guzzi or a Ducati and you can hear every bus or fiat that passes. We were on the 4h floor, and every time we opened the one of the big windows, fresh air came in with lots of noise. Breakfast was good, though surprisingly for Roma - the coffee was made from an automatic machine, so we skipped the coffee there and went a block up via Giulia to a local coffee- that really takes pride of their wonderful coffee. Don't expect a real GYM when you go down to get rid of some pasta calories or a hang-over, though the warm big whirlpool is nice during the winter evenings. One Caveat - at the price we paid, you'd expect the entertainment at the room: TV Channels, Music, Movies - to come free or at a very low price. But they charge you like hell for every little song you play. Good thing they have working free Wifi internet - so when needed we went on watching Craig Ferguson on youtube on the iPad They say that the quality of your domicile in Roma is based mainly on how far you are from the local farmer's market. Hotel St. George is located a short 5 min walk from the lovely Campo di Fiori market - open every day and delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not five star”
Reviews.Author: Andy O
Reviews.Content: Great location, our room was good size and they threw in a bottle of wine as we were celebrating our first wedding anniversary .......bathroom was fine for my needs though the wife would have liked a bath rather than just (large) shower. They could and should make slightly more effort with the outside entrance- we thought initially our taxi driver had brought us to his family home! Their are no cabs waiting outside and so a reasonable walk along cobbled (and therefore not ideal for the elderly or women in heels) streets is the only option.....but when in Rome walk! (just look out for the pickpockets of which many including us have a story to tell) Main complaint relates to the roof top bar- which looks fantastic on the website and at which we were hoping to kickstart the aforementioned anniversary celebrations......on making our way there on the Saturday evening we discovered it was closed for a private function and as it is always closed on Sunday's we had to forgo what should have been a memorable experience....quite why nobody at check in or concierge services bothered mentioning this is beyond us. This I think was the biggest disappointment of all. Breakfast was good and served on a lovely terrace with water feature and quirky little bird.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: janfid
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend in this Hotel and really enjoyed our stay. Location excellent and room very comfortable, staff very helpful and courteous. Good choice of food at breakfast although we found the hot food to be cold and therefore not very appetising. Overall a lovely boutique Hotel with excellent attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Douzer
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 3 times in the last 5 years and its an Oasis of calm amongst the hustle and bustle of Rome. This is a lovely boutique hotel so its not the big grand multi room hotels you find elsewhere in Rome, but thats the beauty of it, it perfectly located down a quiet street just off the main drag but close to all the squares and sightseeing, the hotels restaurant Sofia is just amazing the food is defo Michelin star quality. The ambience is chic and unassuming. We stayed in a double room with balcony, i think there are only 2 double rooms with baclonies out of the 8 that have a balcony the rest are suites, but the doubles are cheaper and not that much smaller than the suites. the spa area in the basement is great for relaxing after a day around the city, yes its small and intimate but thats the beauty of this small hotel, its never overun by the hoads and masses that frequent the other larger hotels but hey every one to their own. ask reception to recommend and reserve you tables at restaurants but defo try Sofia

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Worldhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: 30 min to Spanish steps and Trevi fountain. 10 min walk to Bacilica. Many restaurants near by. Excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Safe Option but Not Special”
Reviews.Author: mike142
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the first 5 nights of our trip. Overall the hotel is ok and not a bad location in Rome if you like a good walk (as we do) as all the main sights are easily walkable, and some nice restaurants are nearby. Good - stayed in a deluxe room at a good early-bird rate. Room was pretty spacious by Rome standards with armchair in little alcove and plenty of room to move around - nice bathroom with separate sink area to toilet and shower - nice roman bath area with sauna and steam room and you will have it to yourself probably in winter - wireless internet is now working well everywhere? (at least in our room) Ok - breakfast was a simple buffet affair with a range of food, good for a couple of days but after 3 its very tired and we noted that some of the cakes and pastries did not change over that time Bad - atmosphere is totally lacking. No one is ever in the bar, cigar room, or the restaurant - prices for the mini bar, laundry are very high, and as usual in Italy there is no chance to iron anything yourself - heating system is as other reviewers noted, its set centrally. although you have an individual control it doesnt actually have any affect on temps, so in winter it was very warm and we needed to intermittently open the window.

Reviews.Title: “Great Times for Vacationing Couple”
Reviews.Author: rbfam
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot and are pretty picky, so trust me with this recommendation. I'm not sure I got the greatest feel for this city in just 3 days but it seemed to be a perfect location. This is an excellent choice. Room was nice, and had space for luggage. Bedding nice, bathroom new and clean. The breakfast was pretty solid - nothing amazing but nice. In the nice weather you can even sit outside for breakfast. We went to the rooftop for a drink and I'd say that was so-so because it was sort of dead, but up there, but no big deal. The people were very nice, and made trustworthy recommendations for dinner and as they even made one or two other reservations for us. Super place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with breakfast and spa”
Reviews.Author: nomadvic
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 solid days researching every hotel in Rome to get the best location with a spa and breakfast included for around £150 per night or under. I found this hotel and managed to get the best price through lastminute.com with 20% off in their sale. (i found www.hotelscombined.com best for shaving the price off places since this sale has now finished.) I also downloaded the voucher from tripadviser to get free internet there. The location is amazing, the staff very friendly and helpful and the spa great for the end of a day of sightseeing. The standard room is a little small for the money and only had a shower, but as our movie channel didnt work (Warning: 12 euros per movie) we were upgraded to a superior which is a much better size if you afford it and are staying longer than two nights i would definitely upgrade. We ate at the restaurant as www.diningcity.com reviewers gave it 9.7 out of 10 and it is in the Michelin guide. The staff were very good the cocktails were amazing but on the whole the meal was very overpriced, its came to 130 euros for 2 champagne cocktails, 2 steak dinners and 1 dessert. The spa is small but very nice after a long days walking, again though i think the treatments are overpriced and there is no couples treatments available as the two treatment rooms are small however the staff down in the spa are very welcoming. - If youre looking for a romantic spa day for two, i suggest you book the couples day at Parco de prinicpi north villa Borgese (http://www.princespa.com/modulo_pacchetti_eng/25200_1_DAY_COUPLE_PACKAGES.htm?id_sezione=30131 but do check that their pool is working as we cancelled when we found it was under maintenance.) The hotel is central for everything, the Vatican, Campo dei fiori and Piazza Navona are all about about 10 mins walk away but the street the hotel is on is quiet. The hotel is not pretentious and the atmosphere relaxing, if you want pure luxury head to via Veneto (Majestic hotel is worth going for the restaurant alone...best ever!!!) if you want a nice hotel and sightseeing is your aim and youre curving your budget but still want upmarket then i recommend here. Have a great trip and here are a few tips: Sunday brunch: Hassler hotel top of spanish steps 54 euros for champagne all you can eat 5 star buffet and coffees with a view over all of Rome in one of the most prestigious hotels. For a special dinner with famous chef beautiful food in incredible surroundings go to http://www.filippolamantia.com/ out of this world. (150 euros for 2 people starter 4 glass of wine, mains and 1 dessert.) Rome is very romantic, if you plan to propose here there is a Tiffany's near the Spanish steps but its very small, but horsedrawn carridges and the restaurants above would all be amazing settings. Lastly, Rome is the capital of fashion but the cobbles are not filled in, walking in heels will take you forever and i nearly broke mine several times, may i suggest evening ballerina shoes and flat boots for sightseeing ladies.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jtpuck
Reviews.Content: Great hotel across the river from the Vatican. This is a small boutique hotel that is really works to take care of there clients. We loved our stay, had a great room that was very quiet and very clean. The room was ready on time and the staff was incredible about trying to help with every question or request. Yes we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: JackoSharon
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews and just having been there, I am amazed that the hotel has not made any effort in improving the negative reports. It is ridiculously overheated and impossible to sleep at night with the windows open, the lack of working wifi/computer space ( everyone had to sit in the lobby)is cause for concern. However, the front desk staff (one helpful woman in the morning at checkout) remain problematic. Why is that? Skip the attempt at a dining room in a city of wonderful restaurants. However, the breakfast is one of the best I have experienced. I would not return here.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sheldon58
Reviews.Content: We were booked for 4 nights , left after just one. Internet was crawl speed & would put most systems in the developing world to shame. No wireless Internet in the rooms, only Ethernet. Turns out the much vaunted Air Conditioning controls in each room are actually a joke - the hotel switches off the system when it deems temperatures to be "cool enough" to do without (?) So we opened the window & didn't sleep a wink with all the road noise . Rooms are tiny (we were in a Junior Suite) ,the front desk is surly and unresponsive , breakfast is mediocre. To be honest, we thought the Hotel was not all that clean . We couldn't wait to get out of there .

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jeff N
Reviews.Content: The St. George was a terrific place to spent our first 3 nights of our 2 week Italy vacation. The staff is very efficient and were very helpful giving directions and restaurant recommendations. The location is excellent as the hotel is on a very private and exclusive street- Via Guilia. It is only about a 10 minute walk to Piazza navonne and the Pantheon and there are lots of restaurants nearby within walking distance. Our room, a deluxe room was quite attractive with a very modern bathroom and a good air conditioner-it was actually warm (upper 80's even though it was early October). The only drawback of the hotel is that there are no real views from the windows-just look at at other buildings. the breakfast room was very pretty and had outdoor seating and the food was plentiful and good quality as well. The only wireless is in the lobby as the room has direct access via an ethernet cable or the tv set. We would definitely stay here again if we visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel within walking distance of many famous sites”
Reviews.Author: blackmetal41
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 4 day break in Rome and the Hotel was perfect. My wife and I are not physically fit, but even for us we could get to the Vatican in 20 mins. We could also walk to the Pantheon and the Trevi Fountain although we chose to get a taxi to the Galleria Borghese and the Colosseum / Forum. There's also the usual open top bus tours that are relatively inexpensive and can get you from one attraction to another. We purchased tickets for the Borghese, the Vatican and the Colosseum on line before we travelled. We walked past the queues snaking around the block and saved ourselves hours of time. The Colosseum ticket also enabled us to bypass another massive queue to visit the Forum. Back to the Hotel, staff were friendly and helpful especially with our queries about getting around and choosing restaurants. The room was very comfortable and clean and the hidden gem is the spa in the basement with its gorgeous heated pool, sauna and steam room. Breakfast was also very good although I have to admit the restaurant in the evening is a bit odd with a very small menu, prohibitive prices and not the best service either. Never mind, you are within walking distance of numerous cafes and restaurants, our favourite being in the Piazza Navona where the fountains are illuminated, there are people performing in the square and the food is lovely. There are at least 8 restaurants and they were all busy. Indeed the walk to and from the Hotel takes you past even more bars and pizzarias. So all in all, I recommend this hotel, I recommend Rome and all its character.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: TravlBugg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St. George for 3 nights, this was a third trip to Rome. We found the accomodations to be superb! The hotel was spotless and the decor appeared to be modern and fresh. The staff was top-notch. The front desk provided superior service and the server at breakfast was excellent. She remembered us, our room number and our coffee preferences each day. Not to mention the fact that the breakfast itself was delicious. We thought the location was perfect! The closest main attractions were the Vatican, Castel Sant'Angelo and Piazza Navona. Although the hotel was great, we found it to be a bit expensive. If we had booked our trip a little earlier, we may have chosen a less expensive hotel with comparable accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy- poor service”
Reviews.Author: drjohn01
Reviews.Content: We had a very disappointing stay here. The bad points: The website is very misleading, the "free gift" with the delux rooms is 1 bottle of water, the receptionist Jonathan laughed at me when I asked about this, he said its probably "a bit of miss advertising" , but probably best not to laugh at guests. There is no wifi in the rooms and if you don't get a delux room you even have to pay to use it in the lobby. The spa is not always staffed, I saw one guest walk in on someone having a massage trying to find where to get a towel from. The one time I saw a staff member she walked into the spa and shouted at everyone to turn off one of the communal showers someone had left on! Again when i asked the receptionist Jonathan about staff in the spa he said I could call one on the telephone in my room if I needed to speak to one. The rooms are described on the website as soundproofed which is a total lie. The doors have heavy locks on them that require you to slam them shut to lock them. We could hear people walking up the staires or coming out the lift all night. The rooms and bathrooms are very small, even in a delux room you had to stand in the shower cubicle to close the door to use the toilet. Despite it being lovely and sunny the roof terrace wasn't open to sit and enjoy the sun. Good points Lovely spa Good location Good breakfast with excellent coffee and very helpful friendly staff serving breakfast Overall for the money I just don't think it's worth it when there are so many great hotels in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but make sure to get at least a deluxe room”
Reviews.Author: GMM0
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 3 nights at the St. George. The hotel is in a fabulous location - about 10 minutes from the Vatican or Piazza Navona, 5 minutes from Camp de'Fiori and walking distance to ancient Rome, Spanish Steps, etc. It's a lovely boutique hotel with complimentary gym, sauna and steam room facilities - which is a great perk! However, the main highway runs perpendicular to the hotel and if you are in a standard room in the middle of the hallway, it sounds like a freeway outside your window 24/7. We asked for early check-in and because of this, probably got one of the worst rooms in the hotel. We were so tired our first night from traveling overnight and just wanted a good night's sleep. Unfortunately, we were up most of the night with the traffic - horns, and all. It was absolutely awful. The room was really small too. The hotel bills itself as a 5 star, but no 5 star would offer rooms like this. I checked Trip Advisor and was shocked that no one had mentioned this. There were posts about how quiet Via Guilia is - which it is - but none about the highway noise. I complained to the front desk the next morning and they told us they could upgrade us to a junior suite for a small fee. We were ready to check out and forfeit our payment, so the discounted upgrade was a deal for us. Our new room was wonderful - quiet, large - perfect. It was on the Via Giulia side of the hotel. After our first night I would not have recommended this hotel to anyone, but as long as you pay up for at least a deluxe room and specify that you want a room on Via Giulia, it's an ideal location with a great breakfast and some great perks. In warmer weather there's a rooftop deck - it was 85 when we were in Rome so surprised it wasn't open - but it sounds like it's another great feature of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Friendly and welcoming.”
Reviews.Author: Jason_from_London
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 3 night stay at the St.George. Admittedly on arrival, the outside of the building looks rather disappointing but once inside, the interior is smart, polished and welcoming. The staff are wonderful and we experienced a good level of service from the front desk, the breakfast team, the roof-top bar, the spa, even the hotel maids smiled and greeted us with a chirpy 'buongiorno'. Our room (307) was a reasonable size (by european standards) and the bathroom was bit of a squeeze but we didn't mind. The inclusive buffet breakfast was very good with plenty of choice. Whether you're a light eater or you have a big appetite, there's a good selection of hot and cold dishes. On each evening's return to the hotel we headed to the rooftop bar for a late night drink. We noticed that the bar isn't open during the day which is a real shame because it's such a great addition. Complimentary bruschetta and crudités are always served which is a nice touch. We loved the spa and enjoyed the pool. Make no mistake, officially on the website it's referred to as a Roman bath or Turkish bath but this was simply a hydromassage pool measuring approximately 5m square. Not big enough to swim properly but enough for a relaxing dip. You can walk everywhere in Rome and for us, the combination of the late autumn heat and achey feet, the pool was a welcome addition. The spa also offers a wide range of treatments and they get booked quickly so plan ahead if you feel like some time out. The hotel is located in the historic centre but in a quiet part of the city near the river. We found it to be well located for the Vatican City, Piazza Navona, the Pantheon, Campo di Fiori, via Condotti, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain... you get the idea! Rome is a city that is best enjoyed on foot - there is history everywhere you look. For those who love shopping, sadly Rome doesn't quite compare with Milan or even Florence. Obviously there are the high end luxury stores and a handful of interesting independent stores but not much in between. As for eating out, there is plenty to choose from. Beware the tourist traps but for us we particularly enjoyed the restaurants and the atmosphere in the Trastevere district. This was an easy 5-10 minute walk from the hotel. On our last day the hotel kindly organised a taxi to take us to Ciampino Airport. We were assured that we not be over-charged (as I was on a previous visit to Rome) because the fare of 50 euros is capped. However when we were in the car, our driver informed us that we would have to pay another 5 euros for parking! On arrival near the airport the driver claimed that the car was having problems and dropped us outside the airport perimeter on the busy main road!! Then he had the audacity to charge us the additional 5 euros for parking despite being nowhere near the departures terminal. With a flight to catch and no time to argue, we simply paid and ran to the terminal. If you organise a taxi drop off just make sure you this doesn't happen to you! An unfortunate end to our lovely stay in Rome and the St.George. This incident aside, the St.George is a great place to stay and I would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, smart hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: JamesA045
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the St George Hotel in Rome this week for work. The hotel is in an excellent location very near the river. Rooms are well-appointed, bathroom was excellent. The buffet breakfast was very good and staff welcoming. The only downside was lack of iron in the room and a €15 per shirt ironing charge. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Rome on business or pleasure. It is 10 mins from the Campo dei fiori, lively square full of restaurants and bars - you don't have to walk far to sample Rome's lively atmosphere! We will stay here on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Perfect location for sites”
Reviews.Author: Geoff P
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a couple for 7 nights, checking on on the 24th Sept 2011. The room was nice, expected size for Rome. Location is quiet, slept well every night. Breakfasts, which were included in the room rate were good with plenty to choose from. As others have mentioned - the pool is small, more of a whirl pool but is just the thing after a long day site seeing. Location is the best - within walking distance of all the major sites and particularly is within a few mins walk of the Campo Di Fiori with its myriad bars and restaurants. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Cyndie W
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and stylish atmosphere — If your desires are for visual treats this would be the place.The spa as well as the top floor restaurant with a great view was a wonderful place to unwind after any sort of day wether it shopping or walking.The concierge was helpful both prior to and upon our visit to recommend airport transfers, restaurants, shopping suggestions and tours.The staff was courteous and such a delight. The breakfast buffet was excellent. Great location. This is by far the one of best hotels in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, price, and room”
Reviews.Author: foodiesforlife
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff, great price ($250 CAD on hotwire) The hotel was in an excellent location close to st. peters square (10 min walk) and to the metro. The room was very comfortable too and after a transatlantic flight I found the turkish baths a wonderful way to relax and recover from jetlag. The doorman, Alejandro is the best! He speaks several languages and knows many insider tips.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: marinadel
Reviews.Content: We only had one day in Rome and the location of this hotel was perfect. We were able to see everything either by walking and taking short taxi rides to all the sites. In the morning we did all the sites to the west of the hotel and then made it back to change and relax for a few minutes. We then went to the Vatican in the afternoon. The best part was after a long day of site-seeing we went down to the spa and enjoyed a nice dip in the pool and steam room to relax. Very nice bonus. The area is so close to a few Piazza's where there are good restaurants and lots of action at night. The room itself was very nice - and the staff and service was great. The only draw back of the room is the sound-proofing - we could hear things on the floor above us often. We were able to overlook this and enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB PLACE TO STAY :-)”
Reviews.Author: RICK J
Reviews.Content: This is really a very nice small hotel . I book the StGeorge as a surprise for my girlfriend's birthday.This hotel definitely have somoething special. The location on Giulia street just aroung the corner from nice momnuments and shopping area il likely one of the best in Rome. We would stay stay here again next year. RJ

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: slk431
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 days in March with my teenage daughter. We booked one of the larger rooms, but I must agree with other reviewers that the beds are really, really, hard here. I don't think it's an Italian thing, we didn't have that experience with our Venice or Florence hotels. Although the room was quite large, it lacked any real furniture to take advantage of the extra space. The bathroom, although nicely appointed and modern, was really very small. And like most European hotels, minimal storage areas. You end up living out your suticase more than you might like for 4 days. And this is really picky, but it kind of got on my nerves.....the floors are bare wood and they are this odd diagonal parquet thing, and the seams between the the planks were almost gritty-feeling. When one walked barefoot on the floor you had the sensation that the floor was dirty. I think I would rather have cozy carpeting, especially for a hotel of this price category. But we did really love the location---fairly quiet for Rome but near lots of stuff. Very polite and helpful staff. Excellent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite, elegant and a gorgeous hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Maria S
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at the St. George by myself on August 6 and 7, 2011. I departed France for Rome and I was awaiting a friend to join me to begin our exploration of Northern Italy. I felt completely safe by myself. The staff is very attentive and considerate, the rooms are lush and lovely, the sauna/steam/Turkish bath is delightful and the proximity to the Tiber and St. Peter's allowed me to walk back and forth numerous times in between various tours. The rooftop restaurant is delightful and the breakfast every morning was sumptuous. I would most definitely return as a guest to the Hotel St. George!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: oehler_melissa
Reviews.Content: The room was good and breakfast was good. I would recommend this hotel when visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Superb, Chic, Sophisticated and well located”
Reviews.Author: WinePleaze
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights in May last year. It was the only accomodation we booked in advance because it was the start of our 4 week European Honeymoon and Rome is not the city to simply walk into. We really did our research because we wanted to start the trip well. Location, value, service and authenticity were important and I'm pleased to say that St George scored highly on all points. The Hotel has litterally been built within the shell of an old building and they have done a superb job. There is a lovely roman bath style pool in the basement which must be a unique feature and there is a very cozy outdoor courtyard for breakfast, where food and service were very good. The room was well appointed but small by my usual standards but we spent very little time in there so it was of no concern. It was very quiet, no bother with noisey lifts, slamming doors or inconsiderate guests, the room product was very good value for what is regarded as an expensive city to stay in. We were there in low seaon so the roof top bar was not open but you can imagine that it would be a very elegant setting in fine weather. We did not eat in the restaurant except for the breakfast and were out and about all day enjoying the most amazing city that is Rome. The location was just about perfect for us because you walk to many attractions and the open air bus routes were but a 10min walk away. All in all, I would easily stay here again and can recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “NICELY SITUATED HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: jajasa
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The room was nice and spacious, no views as it is in a street. It is very close to all the main attractions and within walking distance to the Vatican City. Only problem was that we had paid for Breakfast but the trend now is to charge for eggs. We thought 10 euros for 2 eggs was a bit excessive over and above the breakfast rate we had already paid. There was a strange smell in the hotel which came through the aircon vents - hopefully they will sort this out as well as the lifts which kept on getting stuck. We eventually took the stairs as we were on the 1st floor. The staff were very friendly and accommodating and we enjoyed the Spa and the location,

Reviews.Title: “Great location outstanding adn helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: JurCOST
Reviews.Content: Would definitely stay there again. The SaintGeorge is execellent. Service and hotel decor also top class.. The concierge was very friendly and helpful. The relaxion room provided as part of the spa facilities was superb! lovely hotel.Rooms are luxurious good design perfect for my relax and my family.

Reviews.Title: “Very Central, just what you need”
Reviews.Author: Eric_Sl
Reviews.Content: In fact, there is nothing special on this hotel. The rooms are cleans, the service is OK. The bar on the top is interrresting, and the situation is very central. If you want to be near plazza Navona for an interresting price, go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but clean rooms and average service in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: funtraveler78
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and modern. The beds were very firm so if you like an average to soft mattress your out of luck. We called the front desk and they only had a thin down comforter to put on top of the mattress. The rooms were small but sufficient. Breakfasts were very good and the servers there were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Visited the rooftop bar here and was really disappointed”
Reviews.Author: c13229
Reviews.Content: Went to visit the rooftop bar here. The actual bar area is very nice, but lacked atmosphere (no light music or any music for that matter etc) and extremely overpriced for a cocktail (€20), for ingredients that didn't seem fresh etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but no wi-fi in the rooms, only communal areas”
Reviews.Author: LD73
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel but the lack of wi-fi in the rooms was a real let-down. You have to go downstairs to the lounge or breakfast area to connect. This is 2011! Small but charming hotel in a great area, away from tourist traps but within walking distance of cool sites. The front desk staff were always helpful and check in and out was a pleasure. The breakfast is adequate : hot food is limited to pre-cooked scrambled eggs, bacon and sausage. There is no outdoor pool, only indoor which is fine if no one ese is there due to its small size. The terrace is only open in the evening which is a bit dissapointing.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service, uncomfortable room, willnot go back”
Reviews.Author: sc2088
Reviews.Content: The service was rude and unhelpful from checking in to checking out. The restaurant and bar was completely on the three nights we stayed which is self-explanatory. The room was small and uncomfortable with little space between the bed and window. I would not recommend

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Boutique hotel in good location- We'd stay here again”
Reviews.Author: rogi8
Reviews.Content: We had one final night in Rome before heading back to the USA. We didn't spend much time in the hotel, but were very happy with it. It's a very nice boutique hotel in a good location close to Vatican, Campo di Fiori, Jewish Ghetto, and Piazza Navona. We had stayed on Via Veneto at the beginning of the trip, and thought this was better to walk to dinner. The staff was very helpful, recommended a nice restaurant off the beaten path and found us a plastic container in the early morning so we could take some of the lovely breakfast with us. Our room was rather small, but not too terrible. We'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect and quiet location though expensive”
Reviews.Author: fatimaLuxembourg
Reviews.Content: The good things: confortable, quiet, perfect location near the Vatican, the Campo dei Fiori etc on a beautiful quiet street, Via Giulia, good spa (fantastic to relax after a tiring day), good breakfast, good frontdesk, nice room The not so good things: room too pricey and services too expensive too: Internetcharges, VOD charges, drinks on the toproof... The fact that there is not a coffeemachine in the room and no complimentary water; lack of efficiency during breakfast. If you pay a lot and if an hotel boasts with its five star, it should offer good services and the clients are entitled to a certain degree of service with the price charged. I liked the hotel a lot but think that it is not 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Lamel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at St George Roma for a week in May in a Deluxe Room. For a European boutique hotel, the room and bathroom were more than ample in size. An added bonus was the large walk in wardrobe area. All of the staff were courteous and knowledgeable about Rome, and the local area (which has some of the best (affordable) restaurants in Rome, including Pierluigi at Piazza de Ricci). One of the principal advantages of the hotel is that although it is in easy walking distance to all of Rome's main attractions, it is in a very quiet and safe area. The buffet breakfast, which is included in the tariff, was very good. In addition to the wonderful Italian coffee, a good selection of cereal, breads, meats, cheeses, eggs/bacon/tomatoes etc was available. The dining area itself is intimate, but in the warmer months, we could imagine it would be very enjoyable to eat breakfast in the adjacent courtyard. One of the real highlights of the hotel is a (heated) pool and spa / gym in the basement. It is an unusual luxury to have a pool at hotels in Rome, and was a welcome relief after the many hours of walking the cobblestoned streets each day. Unfortunately, as we were in Rome before the summer season officially starts, the hotel had not opened the terrace area on the top floor, which is reputed to have one of the best views of Rome. We will have to return another time to experience it.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey hotel, but beautiful rooms, lovely neighborhood, and great location”
Reviews.Author: CheffromCA
Reviews.Content: Really liked this hotel. True boutique. Breakfast room was lovely as well. Very conveniently located to Vatican sights, ghetto, campo di fiori market. Away from the madness of the Spanish steps scene.

Reviews.Title: “A trendy hotel in a perfect location but be ready for sticker shock when you get the bill.”
Reviews.Author: SpartanFan73
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with this hotel. The staff was great, the hotel is new (opened in 2007) and it is very nicely designed, very modern, all the required conveniences. The location is amazing, close to everything, 15 minutes to the Vatican, only slightly more to the Piazza Navona and the other major attractions. That was the best part. Be prepared to pay the price however. Avoid the hotel restaurant (grossly overpriced) and do not dare take anything from the minibar. It cost me $9 for a small Coca-Cola Light. Use the WIFI in the common areas to avoid the high cost of internet in your room. That being said the hotel was exactly what we expected and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel..but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: MayaMarjiBitar
Reviews.Content: poor breakfast (doesn't look like a 5 star hotel at all), rooms were not very spacious but very clean. not bad location, staff was very friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Great 5* hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Jason67
Reviews.Content: Despite the under-whelming appearance from the street, this hotel was excellent. Staff: very helpful, especially given that we arrived early in the morning and they worked hard to check us in even though they were fully booked. Location: we really liked the location, away from the more tourist-trodden streets, but still close to lots of great restaurants, the Vatican and many interesting squares and sights, located on a nice, quiet street. Breakfast: good breakfast, excellent hot and cold selections, good service Room: clean, modern, great bathroom, comfy bed Value: good value, we booked through Priceline and got the same rate as we would a far lesser hotel in Rome Overall, a great stay and we would happily return.

Reviews.Title: “History in Luxe Modern environ”
Reviews.Author: doctrav
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect for those whose trip to Italy includes Vatican City and the local historical relics.But if you are a shopper you might find it a hassle to have to travel quite a while to the shopping district. It;s about 10-15 minutes of BRISK walking to the Vatican City, plus a couple of Piazza and Castles. Food:We enjoyed the buffet breakfast- lovely ambience with good selection of cheese and hams.Nearby- try Luigi and Polese trattoria nearby in a little square along the main road (via Emannuel II)- great Roman cuisine at reasonable price- about E$30 each for a 3 course dinner-serving was generous and we were always filled to bursting. Recommend the mussels/clams/lamb chop/Raviola and sauteed spinach. There's some fast food joints along main rd- cheap fried chicken and fries with friendly late-night service by immigrants- great find. Decor-Modern Classic. esp the waiting lounge. Rooms- tiny, we upgraded to a junior suite as we could not bear the claustrophobia having been used to spacious rooms in Asia 4-5 star hotels Service-The bell boy was helpful but the receptionists were quite over whelmed though the hotel seems quite empty, However is still rated as pretty efficient and OK compared to alot of other cities Security Door- always jammed- we were late for a trip as we struggled to re-open our door to retrieve a camera TIPS- the streets along Rome are very tiny and convoluted, so dont rush or you may miss a turning and get lost. TRAFFIC- Most cars give way to pedestrian crossings so it's still quite a safe city. We dont encounter any gypsies so far - mainly fellow tourists so we felt very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Redee2Run
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nites at this beautiful hotel. The location was perfect, the street quiet and beautiful. Our room on the first floor was small but elegant and exactly what we expected. We arrived very early in the day and our room was immediately available. The bathroom was very small even by European standards but functioned well. Breakfast was included and had everything you could want. We used the pool and sauna every day after touring and before our siesta. Saturday evening at 6PM we could hear vespers being chanted in the Armenian Catholic church next door. It's something I'll always remember. The only problems we had seemed to be from the front desk staff. I only made 2 fairly simple requests in 6 days, yet both were fumbled. One request to have wine sent up to the room resulted in no wine and angry accusations of us not answering the knock of the waiter on our door when we phoned to follow up. Another request to contact the airline about our return trip was dismissed as unnecessary. Since our arrival city had just received 2 feet of snow, I thought otherwise. In a five star hotel should I have to explain why I am requesting the staff to do anything? Also please note that there were 4 steps inside our room: 2 from entrance to hallway and 2 from hallway to bedroom. This might cause a hazard at night if one forgets... or drinks too much wine. Maybe that explains it??!! Overall a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bellissimo boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: roo15
Reviews.Content: I didn't realize how fantastic a location this hotel had until we arrived and drove there by taxi. In crowded noisy Rome, the St George is located on a charming quiet cobble-stoned street an easy walk to Vatican City and most of the key attractions. The decor is deliciously hotel boutique, warm, modern chocolate tones yet sumptuous and chic. The beds were comfortable, not hard like others we've experienced in Italy. Rooms and bathroom were standard size for Italy, but beautifully appointed. I really appreciated the alcove at the entrance and and separate walk in wardrobe that allows you to access and store your suitcases and clothes out of view of the bedroom, making it easy to keep the bedroom tidy so as to appreciate the gorgeous decor. The shower could have done with a larger glass door to prevent major bathroom flooding. Breakfast was included in our rate and included a generous buffet of cereals, breads, cakes, meats, cheeses eggs and more. We did not eat at the restaurant, but if you're a foodie you MUST splurge and eat at the 2 Michelin star restaurant, Il pagliaccio, 2 minutes walk from the hotel. The helpful staff on the front desk booked it for me. The only downside to the hotel was the lack of soundproofing between rooms, and because of the marble floors in the hallways, closing room doors was very noisy for light sleepers. Despite this small flaw, we'll be coming back to this hotel next time we're in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in an historical part of Rome”
Reviews.Author: ajpeter
Reviews.Content: We loved the lokation, excellent for walkingtours thru the historical part of rome. Not as busy as the areas with the main attractions. You will have nice walks whichever direction you go. It is not one of these big buzzing hotels with hundreds of rooms and convieniend layed out rooms, all the same and characterless. This is you in rome on your own enjoying the city's diversity, not just the main attractions. It is right in the middle of the old historical part of Rome. Small and narrow alleys full of interesting streetscenes, alternative shops and fabulous small trattorias which serve real traditional lokal roman food. The receptiondesk staff is very helpfull finding you the right place and signing it on the map for you.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location - highly recommend St George Roma!”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous1054
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Rome with my partner to celebrate a special occasion. We stayed at the St George Roma on the "Rome Hideaway " package. The Concierge couldn't have been more helpful before our arrival - organising a limousine service from/to the airport, suggesting/making reservations at various restaurants across Rome, suggesting itineraries etc... The hotel itself was immaculate and run to a very high standard. Our room was very clean, a good size with a great terrace. The restaurant and rooftop bar were both excellent but note, they don't open on Sun/Mon evening. I highly recommend a stay at the St George Roma. It's a perfect base for exploring Rome and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star All the way”
Reviews.Author: kevin33330
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel and the only hotel I will stay at in Rome. It is in the middle of everything but on a back road so you don't have to deal with noise. It is a five star hotel and it deserves all five stars.

Reviews.Title: “Definately Not A 5 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: woodcrest1972
Reviews.Content: I was not impressed with this hotel being rated as a five star. It had very nice common areas, but the roome were not 5 star quality. Beds were hard, A/C was weak, loud and not very cold. there were ants all over the washroom floor. Our junior suite on the 5th floor had no real windows and a cieling that went down to under 5 feet. Felt like I was in jail. They charged me $100 extra per night for leaving early because i was not happy with the room. Be careful not to bring a car. They charge 70 euro per night for parking and then they leave the car on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel St.George Rome Italia...Fantastico!!”
Reviews.Author: isabella20
Reviews.Content: This is a splendid hotel well situated very good service good food lovely rooms!!!!! Will I go back oh yes without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “A calm oasis in the heart of Roma”
Reviews.Author: cathysterling
Reviews.Content: My sister , her boyfriend and I had a lovely stay in Roma at the St. George Hotel. THe staff was VERY kind and helpful, the rooms gorgeous, the spa quiet and cozy...in the center of a very ancient city, to find , in an old building, such a lovely and well maintained hotel is a blessing. The breakfast was excellent, the rooftop bar was amazing, the restaurant perfect. The bathrooms are large and luxurious and the toiletries a treat. I am not sure why there are any negative complaints....my room, a junior suite, was quiet and comfortable. European rooms tend to be much smaller than american hotel rooms, but the suite was large and 3 of us fit in nicely. We booked a room for 2, then we became 3...the hotel was kind enough to upgrade us . A very good experience..Oh, and the front desk was so good to secure a car to the airport for us! I recommend this lovely hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Small Room and Bathroom, Miserably Weak A/C”
Reviews.Author: DavidinMD
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed here for two nights before heading up to Tuscany, and one night before our return to the U.S. The hotel is extremely well located, and we were able to walk to many of the central Rome attractions. It took about 8 minutes to walk to the Campo di Fiori market, which we loved... bought fresh figs that were great, cherries, tomatoes, cheese and paninis. Great place for people watching, too. Anyway, the staff was helpful and responsive, and the hotel well furnished and clean. The downside was the air conditioning. As small as those rooms are, one would think that the mechanical engineer who designed the renovation of the building could have put appropriate sized A/C units in each room. The temperature outside crept into the 90s, and it just never got very comfortable in the room. My other gripe is a small one, but I found that the LAN cable for Internet access was only long enough to use while seated at the desk. After a long day walking around, I prefer to do my browsing and e-mailing while sitting in the bed, and there was no way to do so. Would it have cost that much for them to include a longer cord? We got the room bidding on Priceline, and there was a small savings, but not what I usually experience. Overall the location trumped the inconveniences, and I would recommend with an asterisk.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, subtle luxury”
Reviews.Author: skandercph
Reviews.Content: Absolutely conveniently located on via Giulia, just a short 5-10 min walk to the central piazzas of Rome. Reception was friendly and really helpful in recommending restaurants and nightspots. The room was a bit small but really made up for it in terms of comfort - the bed was bliss. The breakfast buffet was in the courtyard and consisted of a variety of offerings, although it wasn't outstanding. However, this shouldn't be a discerning factor as there are plenty of cafés around, and the lovely rooftop bar as well the spa are gems after a long day of sightseeing and shopping. If you like clean, modern and subtle luxury, then St George is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location and room but hotel a bit penny pinching for a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: TaraLovesTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 week in June. The room was quite large with lots of wardrobe space. The bed was huge and very comfortable! Breakfasts were simple but very good and served on a lovely patio (under an awning). The reception staff were a mixed bag - some very helpful, others a little disorganised but not a big deal really; the only real problem was that we found the hotel to be mean - they do not provide ironing boards/irons and charge for every garment they iron. We forgot about a single small juice we drank from the bar and they wanted to charge for it (after we had paid them over €2,200 for our 7 night stay!) - talk about penny pinching! We arrived late on day 1 and ordered room service; it was served cold (having been heated from frozen) and we were still charged €30 for it. This hotel has a lot of potential - the street its on is lovely (with some beautiful artisan shops) and its away from the main touristy area but near all the sights but a few tweaks are needed to make this a truly 5-star experience. I would recommend this hotel but don't rely on the staff to make reservations etc and don't bother with the room service!! PS Roof terrace is lovely too!

Reviews.Title: “For $325 per night Should I expect air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: wxyz880766
Reviews.Content: Last week, I spent two nights at this wonderfully decorated hotel and barely slept due to lack of air conditioning. At this nightly price I usually get a bath tub and airconditioning. Staff could not have cared less. Rome is smoldering in June.

Reviews.Title: “Average - Not a great Location”
Reviews.Author: owenbouy
Reviews.Content: Was dissapointed with this hotel the location is not good, nothing nearby and a lot of graffitti on buildings surrounding it, also very noisy, near to main road not 5 star in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Catpov
Reviews.Content: Location was great, spending twenty Euros on a taxi ride from the Termini Train Station which took us just over 15 mins. It was close to the Vatican and took us around 10 minutes to walk there, once we found the main road. From all main attractions its no longer than a half an hour walk, even to the Coliseum. Hotel is near a main road which leads to Via Del Corso which lots of the attractions are off. Hotel breakfast was a good American style buffet with lots of choice and staff were friendly and forgiving when we stumbled down at quarter to 11. Reception staff were very helpful navigating us to places we wanted to go and provided us with a map. Bed amazingly comfortable (perhaps due to the amount of walking we did) and the room was cleaned every day by a lovely maid who brought us a chocolate in the evening. We enjoyed pool and spa facilities, even if they were rather small and popular. Unfortunately, we were unable to enjoy it as much as previous trip advisor reviews. Only small negative point would be that the staff behind reception seemed rushed and tried to juggle a few customers at one time.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: DortheAndersen
Reviews.Content: Our expectations were low, because we are use to staing on WLH (world leading hotels), but this hotel was very nice. We especially loved the spa - it was small but fine. The rooms were also very nice. Only negative thing to say, is that the beds are very hard.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent”
Reviews.Author: PicolinoMexico
Reviews.Content: Recent stay for a romantic getaway wth the wife, it is very nice hotel , top of the line. This hotel is a great safe location , walking distance from all to see in Rome...dont think twice about it.....next time i am in Rome , will for sure try to stay there...

Reviews.Title: “St. George Hotel Roma - An Excellent Choice !!”
Reviews.Author: cfserpilli
Reviews.Content: Travelling in Rome with our family of six proved to be a wonderful experience at the St. George Hotel in Rome. Very comfortable rooms - sleek in design, extremely clean & quiet, very polite staff - accommodating to our numerous needs, delicious meals prepared & presented to perfection, centrally located - within walking distance of all monuments. The St. George made out trip a memorable vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad”
Reviews.Author: Dougthelebaneseguy
Reviews.Content: In a great neighborhood especially if you want to be near the vatican. There are nice people in the dining room but the the front desk staff with minor exceptions act like you are bothering them. I have been emailing their guest relations manager for over two months and get no reply. I ordered a bucket of ice from room service and when it had not come I went downstairs to get it myself. The guy at the front desk said "We have seventy minutes to deliver room service". I could not make that up. Having said that for the most part we were happy. They make it sound like they have a pool which they clearly do not have.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but.....”
Reviews.Author: rometohongkong
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located slightly off the beaten path. It is a very nice hotel, we had a good sized room with a view of St. Peter's dome, the beds were adequately comfortable-but not great. The spa is beautiful, Jacuzzi, steam and sauna. But something was missing, mostly the little touches you expect in a hotel of this quality. The nightly turn down was a hit or miss affair 2 nights out of 5. Our room had been made up and there was only a small amount of toilet paper left, we had to call for them to bring up more. One day the kleenex had run out and wasn't replaced, requiring another call to housekeeping. None of these are deal breakers, but it seems they could have done better. Also our room was extremely quiet, not the easiest thing to find in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good with a small reservation”
Reviews.Author: LikestoWalk
Reviews.Content: Generally we were satisfied with what the hotel offered. Our room was adequate but slightly on the small side, but we did expect this as I believe we had the last available room for the week that we stayed. The staff were lovely and did their best to make our stay enjoyable. Unfortunatley we did find the hotel a bit noisy, and it took us a couple of nights to work out why. The doors of the built in wardrobes were very tightly fitted and consequently when guests on either side of us used the doors it was somewhat disturbing, particularly when one of them had an early check out around 5am giving us an unwanted early call!! The location is very central with easy access to the majority of what Rome has to offer. The room and hotel were very clean. The choice at breakfast was almost overwhelming.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: magvictoria
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel for just 1 night by priceline.com and as a result we were absolutely satisfied with our stay. We booked a standart room and got it as the hotel was fully booked for the NewYear days. The room was nicely furnished, airy though it was really on the small side - no corridor, niether any entrance space. The bathroom was rather spacious and nice but had some problems with shower head and leaking of shower plastic-curtain panel. We had the view to the inner 'garden' and so it was really quiet. The breakfast is really good. The staff was just superb, always ready to help with info and bookings. Due to the short stay we didn't have used the bar , spa or the restaurant but I hope it will be one of our choices in Rome to stay in future. I guess in summer this hotel could be even better with their roof terrasse-bar. I would probably rate it more as 4* sup... because the rooms are on the small side and the common areas are not so spacious also. Anyway - it's an excellent hotel for the price, location and the service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Karoliny
Reviews.Content: Really excellent boutique hotel; The room was little small but very nice and clean, The SPA was great for relax after a full day in the " Eternal City ". Breakfast perfect ( it's served till 11 !!!!! ) Concierge... thank you to everibody becouse have perfectly organised every second of my stay... restaurants, city tours, limo, and... flowers... :-) A special thanks to Mr Antonio and the F/O manager mr Landini... have solved a little problem with a big smile. St George Rome.....Se you soon

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Terrible beds and service...NOT 5 star!!”
Reviews.Author: Perfect_Travel
Reviews.Content: The good: Walking distance (under 20 minutes) to all of the major sights Nice pool area and sauna / steam area Great breakfast buffet The bad: Incompetant concierge... at a 5 star I would expect help to obtain theatre tickets, the staff would not help us at all Terrible beds - we actually had to request an extra mattress to be brought for our bed as we could not sleep on the hard mattress Noisy location Air conditioning did not work, but it was too LOUD to sleep when we opened the windows due to the noisy traffice Most expensive room service menu we have ever seen - $30 for a bowl of soup!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: TexasAndrea
Reviews.Content: My husband & I enjoyed our stay at the St. George very much. I am pretty particular about hotels in general, so I was pleasantly surprised to find St. George to actually live up to expectations both their website & trip advisor reviews. We did indulge in the hideaway package - (why not - we were in Rome!). Our room was large (in European standards) ; very pretty, including a roomy bath. (I was shocked to find a little walk in closet in the deluxe!) The staff was very friendly and the key players spoke & understood English quite well. I especially loved the 'spa-like' atmosphere immediately when you walked in the door after a long day of exploring Rome. The location was perfect, the only time we took a cab was to visit the colosseum & otherwise, we always used the river to navigate back to the hotel. The food was really good (an amazing tasting menu was included in our package) - their chef is gifted! really worth it!

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 5 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: speedbirdpik
Reviews.Content: We planned to stay in Roma 2 nights, I have been there lot of times before. The rooms and the toilets are small, corridors small, no free stuff in the room, not even an snack, tv is ugly for the money they charge, for less money I've been in hotels with b&o tv's, the service is ok but not excellent, the hotel is clean, how it shall be. There is an small fitness room, and the spa was u/s. After the 1st night we decided to move away! My grandma did not want to complain but I want to share my experience here with u. I recommend the Rome Cavalieri. We paid 250 each for every room, it is not worth. And don't accept the transfer they offer u for 70€, the taxi from cia is not more than 35! And the car is a Mercedes class E, come on put at least an S class! I will put some pics of the room, and u will see!

Reviews.Title: “Just short of great”
Reviews.Author: PortoTraveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel St George is a lovely boutique hotel in the heart of downtown Rome. The decor is beautiful, with slabs of travertine covering the walls and floor of the lobby, and a very soft and neutral palette of white, grey, beige and light green in the rooms. It's as classic contemporary as it gets. The service is impeccable, the breakfast and bar excellent. It would be a not-to-be-missed property if it wasn't for the lack of maintenance, especially in the rooms, with damaged parquet, and various cracks in the paint. Sound proofing in the rooms definitely needs some work, as does the offer of TV channels. Besides that, it was a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “"La Dolce Vita"”
Reviews.Author: Dan42London
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at the St George for a romantic long week-end. We had a fantastic time and experience the hotel as part of the romantic trip we planned to Rome, the town of the "Dolce Vita" ... and we felt that we have been treated as Hollywood stars! The room was cosy and spotless, the staff was really corteous and well prepared to make our stay unforgettable! All the staff was corteous but we feel that we have to highlight the Front Office Team, and Mr Landini, (hope we spelt right his name), the Front Office Manager for his Impeccable Customer Service and the way he manage his Team. For sure we will return to Rome... for sure at the St Geroge! Well done guys!

Reviews.Title: “Deserves to be more highly rated”
Reviews.Author: Davies72
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St George at the end of September for 4 nights. I booked the hotel through its website and received a good rate because it was for 4 nights. We had a junior suite and our son had a single room next door. Our junior suite was the biggest hotel room I have ever had in a major capital city. We even had a walk in wardrobe! Our sons room was more than large enough. Both rooms looked out on to the Via Guilia but were very quiet. The rooms were light, modern and very comfortable. Not dark and fusty like a lot of hotel rooms in Rome. The bathrooms were also very good with modern plumbing, good water pressure and plenty of room. The location is fantastic. Easy walking distance to St Peters, Piazza Navona and the Campo de Fiori. The number 116 bus (which is a small electric bus) runs down via Guilia and then winds its way over towards the Pantheon, up the Corso, through Piazza Barbarini and then up the Via Veneto into the Borghese gardens. There are also a number of other larger buses that run from the end of the Via Guilia. We took a bus from there over to the main train station as we wanted to go to Tivoli to see the Villa D'este. The service was also great. The staff at the front desk were all very helpful and pleasant as were the house maids. We didn't want a duvet on our bed as we prefer a blanket and the house maid couldn't understand so she just pulled out her mobile phone and rang a member of staff who spoke English so we could explain what we wanted to them and they then explained it to her. The breakfast was one of the nicest we had in Europe. You were able to eat out doors and there was plenty of fresh fruit, pastries and hot and cold items. Everything was very clean and nicely presented. The pool was not large but nice to dip into at the end of a long hot day of sight seeing. We have stayed in a number of different hotels in Rome and now couldn't imagine staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: skd123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very modern and clean. The rooms are average size by European standards. The breakfast that is included with the reservation included hot items as well as cheeses, smoked salmon, pastries, fresh orange juice and champagne for Mimosas. We were so busy with tours that we never had time to use the spa. We went up to the roof top lounge and it was completely empty on a Saturday night. We did not stay for a drink.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, clean & contemporary style hotel”
Reviews.Author: pr1ncessd1ane
Reviews.Content: We booked through Priceline, so for a very reasonable price we were able to enjoy this 5* hotel. I'm not sure I would pay their going rate, however. A very nice American style breakfast was included with our stay and even included mimosas. The front desk staff were very friendly & eager to help. The rooms were not very large, but we did have a king size bed, which was more important to us.

Reviews.Title: “Meets all the requirements, Modern trendy in a great location very clean hotel and attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandPostbox
Reviews.Content: I could not fault my stay in Rome. Accomodation is generally expensive anyway, however i felt i was getting value for money here. Staff did look after you. Location was fantastic SPA Fantastic although the pool was a wee bit cold. Roof top Bar amazing and great views of the city at night..

Reviews.Title: “You can do better”
Reviews.Author: Arctophile28
Reviews.Content: We booked a luxury room but my partner couldn't stand up in 2/3 of it due to the low sloping roofs. It was also very dark and had very poor lighting. The shower was the weakest I have experienced including in much cheaper hotels and the bathroom very small. The facilities for a 5 star hotel were shocking. The Turkish Spa had very limited opening hours & roof top bar was only open from 7:30 and closed on Sundays (not helpful for a weekend stay). They have no concept of using it at other times and its locked so guests can't even go up there. Prices are beyond belief and about 2 times London prices in return for no atmosphere and little view. Expect to pay at least 13 Euro's for a glass of wine. Whilst the breakfast downstairs is very good (as others have said) and was included in our price, if you want breakfast in your room it includes only very basic bread products, juice and coffee and it will cost you £25 PER PERSON for that to be delivered!!! The very definition of extortion. Room service soup is £26 and mixed fried fish £45 (plus of course the £25 room service charge PER PERSON). Coffee was very good but no facilities to make any in your room. On the plus side, the location is great, tucked away in a quieter corner of Rome but only 15 mins from the Vatican Sq and 15 mins from Piazza Navona (worth a visit) and lots of interesting little lanes. The hotel was spotlessley clean and had chic minimalist decor but there was absolutely no personal touch. Staff were all very professional and helpful. The prices and access to the facilities brought this score right down. The Euro/Pound exchange will only serve to highight this over-charging. We'd return to the area but not to this hotel which is a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not outstanding.”
Reviews.Author: GigNYC
Reviews.Content: The rooms were really clean and nice. The service was good, and breakfast outside every morning was a nice feature. But there were two downsides: The hotel is very loud. Not the guests, but the actual floors and acoustics echo and make everything sound much louder. I was woken up a few times by the sounds of doors slamming and footsteps or the maids early in the morning. The other downside was the prices. One night we went to the roof bar to have a drink, and a non-alcoholic shirley temple was about $17. The restaurant in the hotel was very expensive too, and I never saw anyone actually eating in it. Overall a nice hotel and a good experience, but not for light sleepers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and beautiful establishment at a good price”
Reviews.Author: TraipsingAround
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St. George for the first 2 nights of our honeymoon. We booked on Priceline so we got an amazing deal. The location was perfect, walkable to all the major sites. The room was small (of course, this is Rome), but comfortable and beautifully decorated. The bed was very comfy, the shower had great water pressure, the TV had 5 English channels... all and all, great. The breakfast was awesome! So much to choose from (too much to list) and great service on the coffee and tea. The rooftop terrace was lovely. Of course, drinks are a little pricey, but we expected as much. It was worth it for the sunset views of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Tiresomely expensive and aims to look good in a glossy magazine”
Reviews.Author: C.Elder
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in the historical centre,narrow cobbled streets,atmospheric but difficult for a taxi to get to-no public transport nearby and streets don't lend themselves to suitcase on wheels.Hotel is in minimalist(to an extreme?) style and has been carved out of much older property.As such rooms are very small-they claim 20 square metres, which would be 4 by 5.When you consider that a basket ball player is 2metres plus ,then you are talking,basically 2 basketball plaers lying end to end by 2 more . The bathrooms,usually a strong point in italian hotels(all that marble etc) are very small, again probably due to the constraints of the original building. As others have mentioned,if you get a good rate-well done.But ANY thing extra is enormously costly.The restaurant is hugely expensive and nouvelle cuisiney(not exactly what you go to Rome for)so give it a miss.Drinks and wine are priced at the level of a very top end London hotel.I was astonished to see italian wines on their list at prices above those in top London restaurants for the same wine.go out to eat and drink is my advice. So it's all a bit over done in the end.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great”
Reviews.Author: katarob
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July, in our last night in Italy. We had booked a "deluxe" room in their website, prepaid for supposedly a discounted rate. The room was well furnished but not big. Bathroom was adequate size, very modern. Upon arriving we noticed the room was a bit warm but we thought it was that the A/C had just been turned on and it was middle of the afternoon of a very hot day. When we came back around 6 PM the room was sweltering. We called downstairs and they sent somebody up. The person said the repair would take like 30 mins, to let them know when we left for dinner they would come and fix it. When we came back around midnight the room was still very warm. I called the front desk who was apologetic but didn't know anything about it and didn't offer any solution. The bed was very uncomfortable and soft.. Between that and the heat it was a very unpleaseant night. The next morning upon check out I complained. The guy at the front desk already knew about our problems and offered to comp us the drinks we had on the rooftop bar the night before. Not great, but at least something (especially since the price of the drinks was exhorbitant!). I really couldn't recommend this hotel for what they charge, even if it is their prepaid "discountd" rate.

Reviews.Title: “A luxury bolthole in bustling Rome that doesn't quite make the grade”
Reviews.Author: jwilsonlondon
Reviews.Content: The St George Hotel is a luxury retreat tucked away in a quieter corner of Rome. It's slightly off the beaten track but a 15 minute walk takes you to Piazza Navona. The hotel was spotlessley clean and we liked its chic minimalist decor, however for us it lacked the personal touch we would have expected from a 5 star 'boutique' style hotel. Our room was clean and comfortable but offered no outstanding features. The bathroom was on the small side. We were disappointed that some of the facilities that attracted us to this hotel (Turkish Spa & roof top bar) were closed on certain days - in a 5 star hotel we expected them to be available throughout the duration of our stay. Drink prices at the roof top bar were exorbitant, 22 Euros for a cocktail, 13 Euro's for a glass of wine - twice the price of the drinks in a bar we visited in on Piazza Navona which is reknowned for its high prices due to its unique atmosphere. We enjoyed our stay but this hotel didn't quite deliver to our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: bostonlagunacommuter
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights in August 2009 and thoroughly enjoyed this small modern hotel in the heart of Rome but on a quite side street away from traffic. Consistent with other viewers I would say the highlights are location, modern clean rooms, beautiful common areas including rooftop terrace, very nice courtyard breakfast and modern (though small) spa. The restaurant and bar were quite expensive but we easily walked to the dozens of alternatives near Piazza Navona. It is true that the 1pm-8pm spa time can be a little limiting... we found ourselves racing to get back there one evening. The spa is incredibly refreshing after a hard day of walking tours. I would definitely stay here again. We paid about $275/night through 1800Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest Bathroom I Have Ever Seen”
Reviews.Author: MissingCanada
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was O.K. but only because we got a good deal. The room was one of the smallest I have ever been in. The bathroom was ridiculous. You couldn't close the door once you were in. Twp people forget it. The restaurant and roof top bar were so expensive that we never saw anyone in them the whole time we were there. 5 stars...are you kidding me?

Reviews.Title: “impressive”
Reviews.Author: ymaraghy
Reviews.Content: this is a very nece hotel. so clean and near the main attraction in the city of Rome. The room is clean, modern and cozy. I like that place very much the only problem is that it is not well known for taxi drivers so take care from that. Breakfast is ok and the terrace viewing the dome of the saint pedro . It is simply one of the best hotel i been to in rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous St George”
Reviews.Author: LondonRocket
Reviews.Content: We recently spent four nights at the St George. The hotel is definitely five star, looks wonderful, and is in a great location for all the attractions in Rome but is slightly off the main noisy streets. Great restaurants nearby. Lovely spa. We had a junior suite, which though beautifully appointed, was to be honest rather dark as it faced onto the atrium of the hotel and other rooms, so we had no view. I would certainly ask for a room with a more open aspect next time. Our daughters and her partner on the other hand, had a lovely large room with views over the rooftops of Rome and again lovely facilities. We didn't eat dinner in the restaurant, which was very expensive, but the breakfasts were great, with everything you could wish for, in a lovely sunny courtyard. We often visit Rome and have never settled on a hotel before, but will certainly go back to the St George.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome, (During the summer get a rome with AC)”
