Reviews.Author: i_spy1811
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful, the staff was helpful even though it was late in the season. The room was always warm even with the air condition running. Just down the street about a block away my wife and I found a little Italian style Ace Hardware. They spoke no english and my Italian probable sounded like a cat in the blender, but we got the fan. Room was adjacent to the outdoor breakfast area which

Reviews.Title: “hip and trendy yet comfy in charming section of rome”
Reviews.Author: HooferNewYork
Reviews.Content: This is one of those trendy little boutique hotels of the type that have become so popular in big cities. Yet set in a very charming section of town with a great deal of character. Close to Piazza Navona and Campo de fiori yet not right on them (which would be too noisy and touristy).... I totally LOVED the indoor pool/sauna and rooftop bar, plus the garden area for taking breakfast (no mere contintental breakfast but lots of fresh cheese, fruit, meet, salmon, etc.) walking distance to almost everywhere you'd want to go -- vatican, trastavere, pantheon, and perhaps half an hour to coleseum and spanish steps. Staff a bit too "cool" to be of much help, unlike in family-run places. E.g., woman at desk told me (on a 95 degree day in Rome) not to wear shorts to the Vatican; turns out you can as long as they are clearly over the knees. Still, stay here and you won't be disappointed. Great digs, great area, good price.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet haven in a very busy city”
Reviews.Author: minnieLeeds
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a five night stay at the St.George. The hotel is situated in a quiet street just a few minutes walk from many tourist sites- 10 minutes to Piazza Navone, 25 minutes to Spanish Steps, 10 minutes to Vatican etc. From check-in to check-out, all thye staff - front desk, concierge, housekkeping, breakfast staff were all very pleasant and any requests we had were attended to immediately. Breakfast was included in our room rate and was totally fine - eggs, bread, cheeses, jams, fruit . It was nice to sit in the pleasant courtyard and start the day in a relaxed way over a cappucino. My only complaint was that although our room (we booked a superior room) was very large for a European room, the bathroom was tiny and had no space to put any toiletries at all. We would definately recomend this hotel to couples looking for a slice of quiet in a very hectic pie!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: Shadia72
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just returned from our 2nd honeymoon in Italy & we stayed 5 nights at the St.George! My husband was the one who chose this hotel & I was a bit skeptic but as soon as we arrived I changed my mind! The St.George is a small boutique style 5* hotel located in Via Giulia, one of Rome's most beautiful streets & is close to Rome's major attractions (Piazza Navona, The Vatican, The Pantheon...). The service is great, rooms are cleaned twice per day, the personnel are helpful & cheerful, the breakfast is nice & you can sit outside in the courtyard ... We loved it & will surely return there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed stay but with some reservations ......”
Reviews.Author: Jennyx
Reviews.Content: Hotel George is a new boutique hotel located in the pretty and quiet Via Giulia, about 15 minutes walk from the Vatican. From the outside you might walk past it without noticing it. It has been decorated in a trendy cool style with lots of travertine and marble on the walls and floors (more of this later). Our room was on the second floor and to the side of Via Guilia. It was quiet, nicely furnished with a decent sized bathroom. Plenty of hanging space but it sorely lacked storage space for other clothes not usually put on hangers. The bed was very comfortable. Staff were friendly and polite. You can walk to all the main sights from this hotel. We did not eat at the hotel. At 25 euros for breakfast we thought this was somewhat expensive. We were there on a Sunday and Monday and the rooftop bar was closed so cannot comment on this facility. Did not use the Spa. Our one main criticism of this hotel is that it is acoustically noisy because of the stone walls and floors. Our room was located near the elevator so we heard every footstep of everyone going to their rooms. Even the closing of the doors resulted in a loud crashing noise. I was dreading having someone above us who walked around a lot and had on high heels or heavy shoes - the rooms have stone floors too. Luckily the people above came in and went to bed pretty promptly. Unfortunately the cleaning staff came in early and they could be heard talking and moving their equipment around. It should be pointed out to them how their voices carry in the corridors.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with great service”
Reviews.Author: Theosmum
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for a 4 night break at this lovely boutique hotel in the centre of Rome - in the adorable Via Giulia. Quite expensive and we decided to go out for breakfast as i found 25 pp too much for a coffee and croissant. Hotel seemed very empty maybe the rates are a little on the high side..... but i liked the atmosphere and the staff were very professional and friendly. I would definitely go back - but it sure would depend on what rate I would get the room for....

Reviews.Title: “Five-star hotel...of thieves and poor food”
Reviews.Author: Mykhal
Reviews.Content: Fortune Magazine got it wrong with this one. Although St. George is certainly a 'nice-looking' hotel (as you can view on their website), and located in a superb part of old Rome (Via Giulia), I had my Macintosh computer charger switched over the course of 10 minutes. Literally, whoever switched my charger did it very quickly, during a time in which the maid happened to be 'straightening' my room. I left so she could do her work, returning 10 minutes later. Here's the scoop: Apple chargers are universal. The actual plug mechanism is interchangeable. The thief popped off my plug (which had a European adapter on the end), switched the chargers, and then popped the plug back on the one they replaced mine with, as if nothing had happened. However, I noticed right away, as I intended to use my laptop (which was in the safe). I never thought to put my wires in the safe as well.... I immediately contacted the front desk (snobby and condescending), and demonstrated what had happened, in a polite manner. No one appeared to 'understand'. me. In fact, they denied anything had happened, brushing my concerns aside, and pointed out to me while laughing "LOOK...it's American Plug...it cannot be ours!" I showed them the serial number was different than mine, with no success. I asked to speak with the manager, Paolo Falchi; I was informed that he was not available. I left a message that he come speak to me as soon as possible. Palo Falchi never showed. In addition, the hotel dine-in menu is plain and over-priced. Watch your bill, because they double-charged me for a 5E drink. So folks: put your cords in the safe. Especially if you own a Mac...the parts are universal, which make them quite valuable to a thief.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: L0veLuxury
Reviews.Content: The George Roma has recently been done up and is a fabulous small hotel close to all the major attractions. From the outside, it doesnt look much on a narrow cobbled street, but as soon as you walk in, you can feel the quality and cleanliness. The design is very modern and all the facilities are high tech and luxurious. There is also a beautiful Spa but unfortunately with all the sights to see, we didnt get the chance to enjoy this. We were celebrating our 10th Wedding Anniversary so chose a Deluxe room which was large and very comfortable. In fact my husband said it was the best bed he had ever slept in at a hotel! There is a beautiful courtyard for breakfast and a breathtaking terrace for evening drinks overlooking parts of the City. We didnt eat in the restaurant but the food looked fabulous. Whilst it is not cheap, they offer you 5* Luxury at a vastly reduced price than other well known 5* hotels in Rome. The staff were extremely helpful and recommended some great local restuarants to eat in at night. If you do stay, make sure you go to Osteria Romana (5 mins walk). Here you will not get a menu but will receive a selection of excellent fish or meat dishes chosen by the chef - best restuarant ever! I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough! Although I would say that it is more suited to couples than families.

Reviews.Title: “A five star hotel that would benefit with higher level service”
Reviews.Author: vagabondwoman
Reviews.Content: Stay was five days. Luxury hotel, with small but beautiful spaces. The front desk staff was fine, but seemed to lack the polish and quality of service usually associated with a five star hotel. The breakfast was excellent, as well as the staff in the restaurant. Room was lovely, beds comfortable, but the doors closing in the hallways can wake you several times a night. They need to add some buffers of some sort. Location is quiet, and near Vatican. It's worth the cab ride to and from the airport. If internet was included in room rate, and room service menu had a wider range of choices and prices, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A top visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: glynnAshfordKentUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St. George's Hotel in October 08. The location was superb!Right in the middle of 'old' Rome and east walking distance to EVERYTHING! Although we were a little disappointed with the frontage of the hotel, the interior was great and the reception staff helpful and friendly. We had booked a double room and, although there was everything there that you would expect from a 5 * hotel, the room was a little small. I would recommend up-grading the room, especially if your stay is for a special occasion. We only had breakfast at the hotel which was self-service and plentiful. Overall, a really nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice hotel and very nice atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: MyTom11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located about 5 minutes walking from piazza Navona. The only problem was that there is not any train station or subway close to the hotel, but in rome you are going to walk all round.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely.... but small and pricey!”
Reviews.Author: LondonNeel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel over the Easter break. Enjoyed our stay very much. Pros: Great location, great staff, flexible... allowed a very late check out! The rooms are high nicely finished Cons: Expensive! Room service Burger and chips is 26 Euro! Didnt taste it just in case it wasnt best burger in the world! Rome does have free mineral water coming out of every crevice on the streets, you would think they could at least provide you with 1 bottle for free. But all these things are easily available a short walk from the Hotel so I would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning boutique hotel with lots of modern charm”
Reviews.Author: CPandDPLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St George for 5 nights over New Year. Having orgininally booked the Exedra, we decided we wanted a more intimate hotel and found the St George. The location was also better, inbetween the Vatican, Trastevere and the Spanish Steps area, close to Piazza Navona on a lovely cobbled street surrounded by small restaurants and boutiques. If like us you like to avoid transport on holiday, you can walk everywhere from this location and get a bit of exercise (max walk was probably 30 mins to the Colosseum). The hotel itself was lovely, total understated luxury. The room was on the 5th floor with a double balcony and was modern yet charming. We loved it. The breakfast included was great to start the day but other meals were expensive (the Euro didn't help!) so we ate out every night. The roof terrace looked amazing but closed as it was Dec. Also lovely to have a pool and spa after a long day in cold Rome! If you like luxury but try to avoid the big chain hotels then I would highly recommend the St George.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Marchetta01
Reviews.Content: As a frequent visitor to Rome, who has stayed in many of the best Roman hotels, I can highly recommend this hotel. I decided to stay at the St. George for the first time in January. From my first contact with the staff by e-mail two months before my stay, up until check out, they were all professional and helpful. The front desk answered all my questions and concerns. The breakfast and dining room staff were pleasant. My room was extremely comfortable and quiet. I felt that I received good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “The Miniature Five star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vanderluyden
Reviews.Content: We booked a three night stay through the hotel website which had a nice discount, so we ended up paying what I think the appropriate rate for this hotel. Pros: great location and great area, one of the best in Rome. Nicely done in a minimal style décor. Good service, room clean, luxurious duvet covers. Staff nice and helpful. Very good breakfast, nicely appointed tables with linen tablecloth and napkins. Cons: Everything is small: the reception, the room, the bathroom, the Spa area, not what you would expect from a deluxe five star hotel. Free WiFi in the lobby but on payment in the room. I've read previous reviewers complaining about noise from road: noise doesn't come form outside but from the inside! Paper thin bathroom walls so you hear everything: water flushing, shower running, people sneezing, quite annoying! Turn down service, is just a change of towels and every evening a brand new doorknob hanger on bed. I have got a whole collection! No weather forecast, no little chocolate, no bottle of water! Sad. Appliances in the bathroom a little 'loose', although it is a new hotel; the feeling is that it was done on a 'save every penny' project. We went up to the roof terrace to have a view but it was locked up and from all the rubbish strewn around it looked like it is undergoing major repairs work. No real concierge service: we asked for tickets to some of the exhibitions but they couldn't provide any. We had dinner in the hotel restaurant on our last night there: a lot of nice choreography but little else to remember. All in all it was a good stay, provided you get a nice rate, not worth the regular price.

Reviews.Title: “Five star service with a smile!”
Reviews.Author: unclepat
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the St. George for three nights over Christmas. From the moment we walked in, we were warmly greeted and this set the tone for the whole of our stay. The hotel itself is very tastefully restored and the design is stunning. The rooms are large and very well appointed. Breakfast was good but we didn't eat dinner in the hotel as we had already made reservations at other resturants but the menu looked very good. We will definitely stay at the St. George next time we visit Roma because apart from the fabulous design, the staff have a genuine warmth about them that can sometimes be lacking in 5 star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “St George Roma - Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: gedwa
Reviews.Content: I've recently returned from a two night stay in Rome at the St George. The staff at the hotel, from the maid to the manager, were all very friendly and efficient. We had a number of alterations to make to our itinerary and rather than us wasting time doing it ourselves, the staff took it off our hands and re-arranged everything. You would expect efficiency in a 5 star but you can be greeted with stuffiness in some places - not here though. The daily, warm greetings were genuine. Being smaller than some of the major chain 5 stars, personal service seemed better. We also received a room upgrade, and on the second night a complimentary bottle of wine was left in our room (unprompted) as we'd mentioned it was my wife's birthday. Thank you St George!

Reviews.Title: “excellent, but.....”
Reviews.Author: italiano666
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from the st.george rome, it was fantastic, the spa is so relaxing, and the staff can't do enough for you, especially the concierge and reception staff, however one of the staff in the restaurant in the morning was incredibly rude to me and my fiancee, it was full, so we were told to go into the other room, there was only a 4 seater table available so we took it, half way through our breakfast a waiter came over to us and said we shouldn't be at a 4 seater table, i told him it was the only table, he then said quite rudely "are you sure?" in front of several other guests who shook there heads at him. i didn't manage to get his name, but he was tall, and un-shaven with inch and a half black wavy hair, we might've expected this at mcdonalds but certainly not at a 5 star hotel, on this alone, we would not recommend this hotel and will never return to it because of this. it may seem trivial, but when you're in an amazing city like rome, in a 250euro plus hotel, you shouldn't be treated like a child!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location, with spa”
Reviews.Author: GooseyB
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome for a long weekend and stayed at the St George Hotel. It was a great location about 10 minutes walk from St Peters. We had a great time and walked for miles each day seeing all the sights. The hotel is well done out in lovely natural colours and looked new inside. The spa was a welcome treat after a long day sightseeing and sore feet. I don't think any of the other hotels we looked at had a pool or anything so was pleased that we found this one. The room was really nice. A few reviews we read had said that the rooms were a bit small. We had a room in the roof (5th floor) and it was pretty big. The bed was huge! Although the bathroom was pretty small this wasn't a problem. The room we booked said it came with a shower. As we wanted a bath we put a message on the booking asking to have a bath if possible and the room we were given had one. We had free wifi in our room too. The breakfast was great - plenty of choice from fruit, cereal, cold meat & cheese to a basic fry-up and tons of different cakes and pastries. The staff were very friendly and happy to help - they booked the Borghesi museum for us. They all spoke English too. Another review we had read said that it was in a very noisy location. As a result we went armed with ear plugs. If you are a very light sleeper you may hear a bit of traffic but we didn't really hear much other than the torrential thunderstorm that woke us one night! Occassionally you could hear room doors shutting loudly on our floor but there were only about 4 rooms on our floor it wasn't a problem. Would definitely go again and highly recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: pmonter
Reviews.Content: We found the location, a block from the Tiber and a short walk to the Ponte Sant'Angelo, to be fantastic. The room itself was euro luxe and comfortable but we found the common spaces, lounge, dining room, etc. to be nice but very chilly as in not welcoming. Worst problem was the amazing amount of noise from the street along the Tiber a block from the hotel. Bring earplugs! Overpriced but so are many hotels in Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service”
Reviews.Author: Ballydorn
Reviews.Content: The St George is the best Roman hotel we have ever stayed in. We got a last minute deal which made it even more attractive. Our treatment by the staff was first class. We are a retired couple and we felt cossetted in an unobtrusive way the whole time we were there. They arranged private transfers from the airport to the hotel and back again at quite reasonable rates for Rome. The breakfast is a bit heavy on sweet Danish pastrires for our taste, but the scrambled eggs are excellent. Thanks to the Tripadvisor reviewer who recommended the restaurant just beside the police station. (Il Drappo) It is indeed superb, but it is Sardinian, not Sicilian. It is very popular with the locals, in fact it is essential to book at weekends and probably a good idea even earlier in the week

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous George”
Reviews.Author: teaandcake
Reviews.Content: The St George is a really good hotel in every respect. Lots of hotels seem to use the Spainish steps as a measure of centrality but we thought this location was better. It is in the historic centre and within walking distance of St Peters, Travestere (just over the river where there are lots of bars and restaurants), Pz Navona and not too far from the Spainish steps and shopping either. Its also on an interesting and quiet street with all sorts of antique shops and a great Sardinian wine shop. The hotel is well designed in a contemporary but very comfortable style. I think it is probably the cleanest hotel I have ever stayed in. Our room, a standard deluxe double was not huge but almost perfectly formed. To be perfect it needed a bath as well as a walk in shower but I am sure other rooms had a bath. The room was cleaned every morning and towels changed twice a day if they were used as part of their turn down service. The hotel has an outside breakfast terrace on the ground floor, restaurant (which we didn't use as there are so many places to eat near by), spa with small pool and treatments, and a roof terrace for cocktails in the evening. The roof terrace was not open on Sundays or Mondays when we stayed. But when it is was open the cocktails are wonderful and the views with the sunset were lovely. Whilst we were there we got tickets to see Roma play Napoli and had a great time. The supporters are as interesting to watch as the football. Getting to the stadium is a bit of a trek but the bus goes from the road along the river, just near the St George. If you are going to Rome, this is a really good choice and not too expensive by Rome standards. We would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “New stylishly renovated central hotel”
Reviews.Author: salbags
Reviews.Content: This hotel has only been opened for about 18 months and still looks fresh and very stylishly decorated thoughout. Our standard room was beautifully decorated, but small especially the bathroom and considering the beds were new, they were already sagging in the middle and were not of the highest standard. The breakfast was basic and could only be described as ok. The thing that we were most dissapointed with was that the roof terrace was closed due to some problems and will remain so until next summer. One of the main reasons for us booking this hotel was that we wanted to have an evening cocktail on a roof terrace overlooking Rome before going out for the evening meal. So if you are looking for a roof terrace don't come here until at least next summer and then check. The one restaurant that the hotel recommended to us was the worst. A real tourist trap, as being in a nice location, but food overpriced and not good. There is a scicilian restaurant just down the road past the police station and 1st left, which was fantastic and priced well.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel in a Great Location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Laura_Loo_London
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 night stay at the St George Hotel & I just don't know where to start. The St George was without doubt one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in!! It's in a great location, just a 10 minute walk to St Peters Sq, the Vatican & Castle St Angelo. The furthest most toursest point being the Colleseum & Roman Forum are about a 20 minute walk or 6 euro taxi ride away. The hotel itself was clean & extremely comfortable in a contempory design. The rooms were lovely, again exceptionally clean, spacious & comfortable. (I loved the bathroom with it's HUGE marble shower cubicle!!) The staff were great - extremely helpful, being able to arrange you require from dinner reservations to taxi's to guided tours around the city. Having had a 3 am start to the day the hotel were very accomodating & despite the 3 p.m check in time checked us straight into our room when we arrived at 11 am. We ate in the hote restaurant (al a carte menu) on the first night, the food was lovely, although quite expensive at 150 euros for 2 courses for 2 people & a bottle of wine. The hotel has a spa which consists of a Roman Bath, Sauna & Steam Room, all available to the guests F.O.C - perfect after a hard day's sight seeing before going out for dinner. I would recommend this hotel for adults of all ages, couples or individuals. A great hotel - I would definately recommend & would definately go back! A thumbs up for the St George!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice botique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LuvToEat53
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the St. Geroge Roma. It was completely and tastefully redone in 2007 so it is like staying in a brand new hotel. The furnishings are modern and the room has a very clean feel. High ceilings. Flat screen TV. Air conditioned. Bathroom amenties excellent. Our room included free internet and movies. A very nice breakfast buffet, with seating in their courtyard, was also included. The room and bathroom are small, but adequate. We thought the price was a bit high, but I suppose for such an excellent location in Rome, that's what can be expected. The St. George Roma is on a very old, very quiet street and it seems that you are somewhat in the middle of nowhere. However, just a few block walk and you will find youself close to the Vatican, the Castel Saint Angelo, Piazza Campo de Fiori and Piazza Navona. The Pantheon is also within walking distance. We walked to the Spanish Steps which was a bit of a trek but took a taxi to the Colesseum. We did not eat at the restaurant at the St. George and did not see one person eating there for dinner during our stay. It is extremely expensive, and even though we don't mind spending the money for a nice dinner, the menu didn't seem to have anything on it that appealed to us. Staff is friendly and helpful, a bit reserved. If you are planning on doing a lot of walking in the area, keep in mind that a lot of the streets are small, uneven brick. I ditched my nicer shoes for walking shoes on Day 2.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, with some caveats about Service”
Reviews.Author: Porpex
Reviews.Content: Given its spectacular location (on the wildly romantic Via Giula, a sumptuous Renaissance Street) and its impeccable, minimalist but stylish decor, the St. George stands poised to surpass the Russie and the Eden as Rome's "must-stay" hotel. To do so, however, they will have to improve service somewhat. Some of the amenities have genuine kinks; motion-sensor lights in the walk-in closet and the front hall of our suite had a funny way of popping on and off at odd hours all by themselves. While we were delighted by our room and the environs, we did experience some peculiar lapses by the hotel staff. On the first morning of our stay, we were awakened by loud pounding; apparently, the suite next to ours was under construction, and we were never warned about possible noise. When we complained, the apology given by the concierge was more dismissive than heart-felt, and we weren't offered any reparation. We were told upon check-in that we would receive a fresh fruit basket daily; instead--by the third day of our stay--the wan peach and the wayward pear in our room had turned to mold-covered mush, and were not replenished. Room service glass and tableware weren't routinely removed by maid service during daily clean-up, and our used washcloths were spirited away but never replaced. When we inquired about gay night-spots at the front desk, the attendant seemed a bit stunned, bless her heart; not the most sophisticated response at a five-star hotel with an international and diverse clientele. At the spa, the Masseur urged us to enjoy the large marble jacuzzi, and--when we attempted to do so--he sheepishly announced that it was out of order. Finally--in the interest of full disclosure--when I made our reservation via the internet, I mistakenly reserved two suites instead of one, and when we arrived and attempted to correct the original error, we were charged the full penalty instead. (In fairness, the hotel was merely following its only expressly-stated policy, and can't really be blamed. But we were staying a full five nights and utilizing the hotel's restaurant, spa and bar, so one wishes in a moment of clemency they'd decided not to so stringently enforce the rules!) But the positives? The breakfast buffet was varied and scrumptious, and the wait staff was attentive and brisk. The bed was insanely comfortable, with a soft, deep pillow and buttery linens. Would we give the St. George another chance? Given its proximity to the Piazza Navona, the Pantheon, and our favorite neighborhoods--the Travestere and the Campo di Fiore--I think we would. And hopefully by our next stay, the service will match the luxurious, inviting surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “The beautiful St. George”
Reviews.Author: TravellerKingston
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel we stayed at while travelling. We got just what we needed at St. George Roma and then some. The hotel was immaculate and very well kept; a modern twist on stylish Rome with exposed stone and marble features colored in relaxing neutral tones. The room was a little on the small side but it was very chic and very comfortable. The underground spa features a turkish bath and mineral pool, while we were there we got the feeling that we were in a converted catacomb as is common in underground Rome. Only a stones throw away from the Vatican. The staff was very helpful for booking tours and giving general information.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location & service”
Reviews.Author: RandLSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: If you like an intimate, boutique hotel, the St.GeorgeRoma has it all: great location on a lovely street (you can walk to a many of the sights), serene rooms as a haven from the bustle of busy Rome, consistently gracious service and a lovely and convenient breakfast buffet (especially pleasant in their garden). The hotel staff took care to provide a welcoming experience which served as a supportive backdrop to a very busy and happily intense experience of the city of Rome. When we return we are certain to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great Location in Rome-Bravissimo!”
Reviews.Author: BostonTraveller93
Reviews.Content: After twelve hours of travelling, the Hotel St. George was a gracious, warm, and comfortable retreat. The staff worked hard to get our "road-weary" bones into our room BEFORE the check-in time. We were travelling with our 10 yr. old son and the Jr. suite was very spacious (large one-bedroom and sleep sofa in the separate sitting room.) My husband said it was the best night's sleep he has had and wants to know who makes the bed linen! The hotel is small and maintains a friendly, intimate feel while delivering a sophisticated and professional 5-star level of service. The staff was friendly, multi-lingual and very attentive to the guests needs. We did not dine at the hotel restaurant because we wanted to sample different Roman restaurants. This was easy to do because the hotel is so conveniently located to the Campo di Fiore, Pantheon, Jewish quarter, Piazza Navona, Vatican, and Trastevere. The hotel SPA was a great place to unwind after a long day of walking the seven hills of Rome. Our breakfast was included in our stay and it was sumptious! Not your stale pastry and bitter coffee but an array of cereals, pastries, eggs, suasage, yogurts, fruit and fresh brewed, DELICIOUS, coffee served by a smiling and polite staff. What a way to start the day!! Suggestion: The bathroom could use two shelves to hold guest toiletries. we had a great stay at the Hotel St. George and would recommend this hotel with a "Bravissimo." Mary & Lenny from Boston, 4/08

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: mikeyrose
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel close to all the major attractions in Rome. The staff was superb in every way. We will definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel (but pricey)”
Reviews.Author: Grace-and-co
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 days at this hotel. We were pleased with every aspect of our stay, particularly the beautiful interior, friendly service and excellent spa. The location is ideal for those who want to explore Rome on foot; the Vatican and Piazza Navona are both a 5 minute walk and the Coleseum is slightly further away. On previous visits to Rome I have stayed on Vittorio Emmanuel and Via del Corsa, both of which are more central but noisy. St George is located on quiet (but interesting) street. My one complaint was that our room (a deluxe) was quite small for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Ripoff”
Reviews.Author: hkbladelawhk
Reviews.Content: Okay, so I do want to start off by saying that the hotel St. George is gorgeous on the interior, and is a very comfortable hotel for the most part. The room I stayed in was a Junior Suite, with my family (total of 3 of us). For the price we payed (£550 a night), I have to say that the hotel is not worth half that for what we get and for what the hotel offers. Pros: -Good continental breakfast -Friendly staff (all I have seen speak English) -Clean, very pretty hotel -Free internet in the ''business center'', where there is only 1 computer. (also a Con) Cons: -For the price of the room, you certainly do not get enough: IE: ---If you do not have a laptop, the internet through the TV is £5 for approx 23 hours. (I happened to have my WiFi enabled PDA, but their WiFi service is not available in rooms, and I didnt check to see if it was free in the lobby, though it does need an activation code) ---Room service prices and mini bar prices are outrageous ($42 approx for a club sandwich...$10 approx for a small container of peanuts) ---We paid about $70 for three drinks in the bar, and it was possibly the worst I have had. ---No shuttle service or anything to make it easy to get around Rome, nothing free of course (at that price they should be driving us around in a limo) ---For a junior st I would expect better bedding, I ended up sleeping on the couch bed, which was amazingly uncomfortable Overall I would not recommend this hotel unless you use thousand dollar bills as toilet paper.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsH777
Reviews.Content: A Beautiful Hotel in a wonderful city. These things we expected from the website, however what suprised us most was how pleasant and kind the staff were at the hotel. They took the trouble to find us a parking space, when there are none! But most memorable was after returning from our evening in the city they had placed Chilled Rose Champagne and Strawberries in the room, as they had guessed from our car we were on honeymoon! Going the extra mile can make all the difference to your stay in any hotel and the staff at St George, Roma did this and more. Particular commendation to Antonio who was both professional and excellent. It may have been the champagne or the fact that we were on our honeymoon, but should you ever visit Rome, look no further than St George when booking your Hotel and indulge yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the St George”
Reviews.Author: HesperisUk
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful stay at the St George We had two rooms on the 5th floor (one superior and one deluxe) and they were both excellent. Very modern (as befits the "boutique style" of the hotel), comfortable and clean. The location is excellent and very close to all the major sites (very short walt to Castel D'Angelo,Vatican and Campo di Fiori) -- this is a major plus in Rome as it is a city designed for walking. Staff were all uniformaly most helpful and accomodatinf; nothing was ever too much trouble (and we had a few outlandish requests !). The breakfasts were pleasant buffet style and it was nice to be able to sit outside in the courtyard. We never had any other meals in the hotel other than brreafast as we were usually out exploring and eating in the diffeent parts of Rome we happened to be in. A quick word about the spa; there is an oversized heated whirlpool which is the same size as a small swimming pool -- wonderful for resting those aching limbs after some heavy sight-seeing Can strongly recommed the St George for a most pleasant and luxurious stay in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in Upscale Rome Neighborhood with Roman Attitude”
Reviews.Author: CruisinFlorida
Reviews.Content: My family and I arrived at the St. George at the end of our recent trip to Italy. We had planned our last 3 nights at the St. George before our departure. From the outside, the hotel looks like nothing more than another apartment building on a cobblestone street in an upscale area of the city. However, upon entering, it is clear why Conde Nast recently gave the hotel high marks. The hotel is very trendy, well appointed and located away from the masses of tourists. However, the day time crew at the front desk, espcially, Landini, could use some lessons in customer service. His attitude most times was arrogant. But then again, almost every resident of Rome we encountered had an attitude and were very unaccomodating. After we checked in, we were escorted to our room which was a junior suite. We had no complaints about the accomodations except that the beds were extremely hard and since we faced the front of the hotel, we could hear cars and people talking outside. Of course all of the hotels in Rome are overpriced. When we asked for additional sets of towels so that we could shower at night and in the morning as well, the housekeeping staff questioned our need for more than one set. We found this inquisition to be offensive. The breakfast was adequate, but was really designed for European tastes. Personally, we don't like to eat scrambled eggs that are more appropriate for drinking out of a cup than eating off of a plate. Unfortunately, Europeans don't seem to know how to cook eggs. However, the Cappacino was delicious each morning and it was very pleasant eating breakfast in the courtyard. We only had an opportunity to use the spa once, but it was absolutely delightful and relaxing after a long day of walking miles throughout the city. The hotel is within walking distance of the vatican, although we would suggest booking a tour in advance. As we were walking to meet our tour, we passed a line that was no less than a mile long. It was great to walk right up to the front door of the vatican and walk in. We booked our tour through the vatican website and were quite pleased with it as it was about 2 hours in duration and gave us a sufficient overview and included a visit to the awe inspiring Sistine Chapel. Since the St. George is not near the tourist hot spots such as the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps, we were able to sample the local flavor of the City. The restaurants nearby the hotel are plentiful and host many local residents as their patrons. Accordingly, dining takes on a whole different meaning. Generally speaking, the food in Rome was inferior to that which we enjoyed in Florence and in the Sorrento/Amalfi Coast area. The hotel is also within a 30-35 minute walk of most parts of the city. We enjoyed walking, but on those occasions when we were tired, we took a taxi ride which was not that badly priced. Don't forget to stop for gelatto at Giaolotti near the Pantheon. Lastly, we took Rome Cabs to the airport. The driver was 15 minutes late although we got there on time. Overall we would recommend the St. George, but of course there are much nicer places to visit in Italy than Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect botique hotel within walking distance to the main Rome sites”
Reviews.Author: Nevadafamily
Reviews.Content: This hotel made our stay in Rome perfect! This hotel is first class in all aspects. Fantastic friendly English speaking staff. Located on a quaint cobblestone street this hotel is in a very well renovated 500 year old blg. Its not very big I think 50 rooms but is very well done. THe rooms are very well appointed with nice beds and linens. All conviences including high speed internet and pay per view movies etc. A very hearty daily breakfast with USA Today is included. A great way to start a day of sight seeing. We loved the hotel. If possible book one of the 5 rooms with thier own private balcony. OTherwise you can enjoy the views of Rome from the roof top deck. THier is a small spa and cardio room - restaurant with decent but expensive food and good wine list.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite ready yet......”
Reviews.Author: Technog0at
Reviews.Content: First of all I have to say that I thought the location of this property was excellent. Tucked away down a cobbled side street of Rome with plenty of atmosphere. Within easy walking distance of the Vatican & a pleasant walk through the centre to the other major sites. (be sure to bring comfy trainers) Prior to my arrival I contacted the hotel to arrange for collection from the airport. This took me 3 e mails & 3 phone calls for the hotel to sort out which I thought was a little unnecessary. However I was met upon arrival & enjoyed a stress free trip from the airport as I watched my fellow travellers fight for taxis. Initial impressions of the hotel where excellent. It has been newly decorated in a very contemporary style with lots of marble, cream & browns which gives it a modern, clean feel. This decor was reproduced in the rooms. Our room was small but pleasant with a shuttered window overlooking a side street. We were well back from the main road behind the hotel however there was still a great deal of traffic noise. The bathroom was nice if a little cramped howver the finishing was terrible!! The sink tap was not properly screwed on, the toilet seat was falling off & the heated towel rail did not work. In the shower, both on/off & hot/cold were reversed! In addition there was a speaker in the ceiling playing some awful "lift" music which would not completely turn off. Even with the switch in the off position the tinny music was just audible enough to be incredibly annoying. The breakfast at the hotel was adequate although the coffee deserves a special mention as it was fantastic. There was a small selection of hot food to complement the continental breakfast. We made it into the spa on our last evening and this is very nice with a small heated pool, gym & sauna. We did not dine in the hotel restaurant preferring to sample the ambience of the areas surrounding the Piazza Navone. I would recommend this approach to travellers but beware the service in Rome is generally terrible. Getting a table & being served can seem like a trial in itself. The exception to this was a meal taken at a swanky restaurant called II Convivo where the service was excellent: however so it should be for the price! Rome itself is a fabulous city with incredible sites & I would recommend it to anyone. But I would also say that it is also the most "touristy" city I have ever seen. The sites literally crawl with tourists & some areas like the Vatican have 2 hour queues to rival Disneyworld!! In summary the hotel was nice but I did not feel it really lives up to it's 5 star billing. The little snags need to be sorted out at this price point

Reviews.Title: “Very poor service, if you drive, reserve a parking or...”
Reviews.Author: antti78
Reviews.Content: I think that the beautiful building itself and the prices should not guarantee five stars. The main characteristic of five stars is the immaculate service, a hotel staff that would satisfy every guest's needs. This hotel is not the case. Straight from our arrival we asked where was the parking of the hotel, the answer is that it was full and we should have booked. Unfortunately nobody told us, even on the website it only says that you have to pay for the parking, but it doesn't tell you you have to reserve it. The terrible Front Office manager told us to go look for a parking spot in the streets nearby, with an attitude of arrogance and no interest at all. He was also fast to point out that one of the rooms was not ready cause we got there before two pm. Fair enough, we went to eat. The restaurant is fancy, was almost empty, 4 people serving. We sat down and ordered fixed menus, which is basically a meal all in a plate. It took them 1 hr and a half. The director was there with guests, ordered similar things, he sat after us and finished in 30 mins. The staff at breakfast is not trained at all, fits well in a three stars. At 3 pm the room was not ready yet, they kept repeating 10 mins. No apologies whatsoever from the man who so hastly pointed out that check-in time is from two pm. We were two couples and a room was ready, but the luggage had not been taken up yet, despite having been around already two hours. Very efficient indeed... Luckily in the afternoon the FO manager was not there, and we got some good info and smiles from Orietta and Jonathan at the front desk. Remember the parking? I think a 5 star in the centre of a city should provide parking for its guests. It ended up that we found a parking on the Lungotevere nearby, the car got stolen. Thank you st. George, not only we had a terrible time because of the untrained staff and extremely rude FO manager, but we got our car stolen as well.

HotelInfo.Name: St. George Roma
HotelInfo.Address: Via Giulia, 62, 00186 Rome, Italy
